dt: {bc}to droop, sink, or settle from or as if from pressure or loss of tautness
{bc}to decline especially from a thriving state
{bc}to fail to stimulate or retain interest

et: Middle English {it}saggen{/it}; akin to Middle Low German {it}sacken{/it} to sink, Norwegian dialect {it}sakka{/it}
shortdef: to droop, sink, or settle from or as if from pressure or loss of tautness
to lose firmness, resiliency, or vigor
to decline especially from a thriving state
